title: Incorrect suggestion to add a bound where another bound is needed

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=54c331139ff05068f86c61f4f685ea52

```rust
trait Parser {
    type Error;
}

trait Enhancer {
    type Parser: Parser;
}

impl<E, P> Parser for E
where
    E: Enhancer<Parser = P>,
    // Uncomment this line to make this compile
    // P: Parser,
{
    type Error = <<Self as Enhancer>::Parser as Parser>::Error;
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `P: Enhancer` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:15:5
   |
15 |     type Error = <<Self as Enhancer>::Parser as Parser>::Error;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Enhancer` is not implemented for `P`
   |
note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Parser` for `P`
  --> src/lib.rs:9:12
   |
9  | impl<E, P> Parser for E
   |            ^^^^^^     ^
help: consider further restricting type parameter `P`
   |
11 |     E: Enhancer<Parser = P>, P: Enhancer
   |                            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
It might not be possible to get the hint so at the very least, I would expect no hint instead of the wrong one. But ideally, the output should look like:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `P: Parser` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:15:5
   |
15 |     type Error = <<Self as Enhancer>::Parser as Parser>::Error;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Parser` is not implemented for `P`
   |
note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Parser` for `P`
  --> src/lib.rs:9:12
   |
9  | impl<E, P> Parser for E
   |            ^^^^^^     ^
help: consider further restricting type parameter `P`
   |
11 |     E: Enhancer<Parser = P>, P: Parser
   |                            ^^^^^^^^^^^
```
(Note the proposed bound is `Parser`, not `Enhancer` anymore).

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
Tested on:
- rustc 1.53.0 (53cb7b09b 2021-06-17)
- rustc 1.55.0-nightly (2f391da2e 2021-07-14)

Possible similar issues:
- #81689
- #58231
